subject: Travel
title: The UNESCO World Heritage System
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The UNESCO World Heritage System.

hook.text: In the 1960s, Egypt planned a dam that would flood ancient temples. The world stepped in.

buildup.text: UNESCO led a campaign to physically move the Abu Simbel temples, block by block, to higher ground.

discovery.text: The success inspired a treaty. In 1972, countries agreed to protect irreplaceable cultural sites.

twist.text: Today over 1,100 sites are listed, but getting on the list brings crowds that can damage them.

climax.text: Venice, Machu Picchu, and Angkor Wat all struggle with tourist overload from their fame.

punchline.text: Protecting wonders sometimes means protecting them from us.

quiz.question: What event inspired the creation of the UNESCO World Heritage system?
options: The fall of the Berlin Wall
